title: What are some words to avoid using in a personal statement? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hey, I’m not sure if this helps, but this is what I learnt in primary school. I thought it was pretty insignificant because the teachers never went through it, but it has helped me much more than I realised. It’s called the IMessage. Basically, instead of saying “You hurt me,” where the ‘you’ is the main subject, more focus should be used on ‘I’. So, you should be saying “I was hurt by your comment,” instead. It sounds less like you are putting the blame or accusing the person you are talking to. However, I did realise later on that it might come off as self-absorbed in some peoples’ eyes. Do take note of that! I think you can fit this into personal statements as well. I hope this helps you and kindly let me know if it did :)
